plugins.name: FontMaster - Switch every font in one click
plugins.description:

FontMaster scans your selected frames or artboards and lists every font used in your design. With an intuitive interface, you can preview and replace any or all fonts across your selection in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing design systems or updating brand fonts, FontMaster ensures consistency without the manual hassle.


üõ†Ô∏è How to Use

  1. Run the plugin ‚Äì FontMaster will automatically detect all fonts used in your selection.
  2. Browse detected fonts ‚Äì View a list of all text styles and fonts present.
  3. Choose a new font ‚Äì Pick a replacement font for each one or apply one font to all.
  4. Apply changes ‚Äì Click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù and FontMaster updates everything instantly.


‚úÖ Why Use FontSwap?

plugins.name: MoroccanMock
plugins.description:
Design layouts more efficiently by pulling text strings, images, and cultural assets from a unique Moroccan-inspired palette. "moroccanMock" lets you create custom Moroccan-themed content and share it with other Figma users. Collaboration has never been easier!


Content:

Browse or search content to find a collection of Moroccan-inspired text strings, images, and icons. Struggling to find the perfect content? You can create your own text and image assets by using Add.


Add:

Create text categories and populate them with your own text strings. You can also upload up to 20 PNGs or JPEGs to create image content. As a creator, you may choose to share it publicly or keep it private. When you create content, it is automatically pinned to the Home Screen for quick access (signed-in users only).


Customize Your Home Screen:

Optimize your workflow by pinning the content that you use most to your home screen. Apply 1-click access to any content type with the switch of a toggle (signed-in users only). Drag and drop items on your home screen to suit your preferences.


How to use moroccanMock:

Find content:

Access saved content from your Home Screen or navigate through the tabs to search or browse content. Pin it for ease of access to your home screen.


Applying text content:

Select one or more text layers in your design to apply strings individually or apply them all. Use the original order provided or choose an order from the drop-down menu.


Applying image content:

Select one or more image layers or frames in your design, then apply the images individually or apply them all in random order.


Applying icon content:

Browse the collection or use the search bar to find a Moroccan icon. Click on the icon or drag and drop it into your design. You can also adjust the icon size to scale as needed.


Creating text and image content:

Navigate to the Add tab, click Add, and select content type. Provide a Title relevant to your content. Set your content to Public or Private. See the terms and conditions regarding usage and rights.


Anwar Bahou

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/bahouanwar
plugins.tagline: Bring Moroccan Culture to Your Designs ‚Äì Instantly

plugins.name: JSON -> Swatches
plugins.description:
Turn JSON into color swatches in Figma sorted by color.


Each swatch includes the color name (if given) as well as Hex and opacity values.


You can add an optional tag for extra detail if/when importing multiple libraries.


Auditing an existing design system? JSON -> Swatches is a great tool for mapping old color libraries to new.

plugins.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
plugins.description:
GridVar helps you create width-based column layout grids with linked variables for any frame width. It automatically generates a set of variables representing different column configurations, including gutters, so you can quickly adjust and find the perfect fit for nested layers.


‚ú® Key Features:

‚Ä¢Quick Setup: Easily create layout grids with variable-based configurations.

‚Ä¢Flexible Widths: Effortlessly switch between column setups to match your design needs.

‚Ä¢Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


üìå How It Works:

Generated variables are conveniently stored in the "GridVar" variable collection. You can find the column width variables under: [Grid Name]/Columns.


Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.

plugins.name: CopyCraft
plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.
plugins.tagline: Text Management Made Simple

plugins.name: Screenshot to 100%
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

accepted.name: Nik M
accepted.description: UX/UI/Product designer with more than 10+ years exp.

plugins.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

plugins.name: Amplifi for Figma
plugins.description:
Quickly assess how intelligible and understandable your text is from directly within the Figma app. The Amplifi Intelligibility Score is our proprietary score that combines a wide range of intelligibility metrics. The score takes into consideration what words actually mean and considers how difficult those concepts are to understand. This creates a true assessment of intelligibility risk.


Key features:

  1. Instantly assess intelligibility for content frames and text nodes.
  2. See a detailed breakdown of what is causing complexity within the text.
  3. See the improvement in scoring after making edits and changes to the text.

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figma‚Äôs local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer ‚Äî crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.tagline: Instant variable import and organization in Figma.

plugins.name: DxH - Layer2JSON
plugins.description: DxH - Layer2JSON is a Figma plugin by Devxhub Ltd. that exports design layers (text, images, shapes) to structured JSON format. Perfect for developers looking to integrate Figma designs into apps or workflows, it supports nested layers and exports essential design properties like size, position, and styles.

plugins.name: Responsive Font-Size Generator (CSS clamp)
plugins.description:
Generate perfect CSS clamp() values for responsive typography in seconds


Transform your Figma text elements into production-ready responsive CSS with intelligent clamp() value generation. Select any text element and get perfectly scaled typography that works beautifully across all devices.


‚ú® Key Features

  1. Smart Typography Scaling: Mobile-first approach with 75-80% reduction for optimal readability
  2. Intelligent Variable Naming: Automatically suggests semantic CSS variable names (--h1-base, --h2-base, etc.)
  3. One-Click Workflow: Select text ‚Üí Copy clamp value ‚Üí Paste into CSS
  4. Container Query Ready: Uses modern cqw units for fluid responsive design
  5. Clean Output: Production-ready CSS with no unnecessary trailing zeros


üé® Example Output

--h1-base: clamp(1.88rem, 4.2cqw, 2.5rem);
--h2-base: clamp(1.5rem, 4.2cqw, 2rem);
--text-xl: clamp(1rem, 2.2cqw, 1.25rem);

No more manual calculations or responsive typography headaches ‚Äì just perfect clamp values, every time.


üîó Also check out our Figma to Oxygen Builder Plugin for complete design-to-WordPress conversion!


wpconverters.com
plugins.tagline: Get perfect responsive Font-Size properties

plugins.name: FrameFlex - Frame Resizer & Scaler
plugins.description:
üîπ FrameFlex ‚Äì Smart Frame Resizing for Figma üéØ

Manually resizing frames can be a nightmare ‚Äî especially when things break.

FrameFlex is a Figma plugin built to help you intelligently scale mobile frames, while preserving structure and layout integrity (when properly set up). ‚ú®


Here‚Äôs what FrameFlex can do:


üîÅ Multi-frame support ‚Äì Resize multiple mobile frames in one action.

üì± Device presets ‚Äì Quickly apply popular mobile screen sizes like iPhone, Android, and more.

üìê Layout-aware resizing ‚Äì Maintains Auto Layout, constraints, and alignment ‚Äî if your design is structured correctly.

üî§ Element scaling ‚Äì Adjusts font size, spacing, strokes, and other properties proportionally.

üéØ Icon/vector protection ‚Äì Prevents scaling on specific elements to avoid distortion.

‚öôÔ∏è Rounding controls ‚Äì Use smart, grid, or exact rounding for clean results.


üí° The more Auto Layout you use, the better the results will be.

FrameFlex works best when your design is clean, consistent, and fully built with Auto Layout in mind.


‚úÖ Focused on mobile-first workflows.

‚ö†Ô∏è Support for other frame types depends on how well they're structured.
plugins.tagline: Resize multiple frames. Preserve structure. Stay consistent.

Stop wasting time saving huge reference screenshots to disk‚Äîjust paste or import them directly into your file, at full quality.
